page.title: 10ROSEMARKET CRICKET CLUB
page.content: There has been a cricket club in Rosemarket since 1885. The team plays at the Vicarage Field which is looked after by the players. The club has thirty playing members (membership fee Â£8) and runs two teams.They play mostly league games but also take part in other competitions and play 'friendlies'. Most games are played on Saturdays. There is a hut on the field which was given to the club by Texaco Refinery. The players have tea in it,which is prepared by their wives and girl friends. The oldest player is 51 and has been playing for Rosemarket for 34 years. The youngest player is 14.
